meta.title: NIST SP 800-82 Rev 3: Guide to Operational Technology (OT) Security
meta.extraction_notes: Key guidance items from Chapters 5, 6, and Appendix G

guidance.title: Risk Assessment for ICS Environments
guidance.description: Organizations should conduct risk assessments that account for ICS-specific factors including safety implications, operational requirements, and unique threat landscape.
guidance.ics_context: ICS risk assessments must consider safety, availability as primary concern (vs confidentiality in IT), and operational constraints that limit patching.

guidance.title: Vulnerability Management in OT
guidance.description: Establish vulnerability management processes that account for operational constraints, safety requirements, and vendor dependencies in ICS environments.
guidance.ics_context: ICS systems often cannot be patched immediately due to uptime requirements, availability windows, and vendor support constraints. Compensating controls are critical.

guidance.title: Network Segmentation and Isolation
guidance.description: Implement network segmentation using zones and conduits following the Purdue Model to isolate ICS networks from enterprise IT and external networks.
guidance.ics_context: Defense-in-depth through network segmentation is critical for ICS. Use firewalls, DMZs, and unidirectional gateways between zones.

guidance.title: Access Control for ICS
guidance.description: Implement role-based access control with consideration for operational roles, emergency access procedures, and multi-factor authentication where feasible.
guidance.ics_context: ICS access control must balance security with operational needs. Consider console access, remote access, vendor access, and emergency override procedures.

guidance.title: Security Monitoring and Logging
guidance.description: Deploy ICS-aware security monitoring that can detect anomalous behavior without disrupting operations. Log critical events for forensics and compliance.
guidance.ics_context: ICS monitoring must be passive and non-disruptive. Focus on network traffic analysis, change detection, and protocol anomalies rather than active scanning.

guidance.title: ICS Overlay for NIST 800-53
guidance.description: Apply the ICS overlay to tailor NIST 800-53 controls for operational technology environments, focusing on availability, safety, and operational constraints.
guidance.ics_context: The overlay provides ICS-specific guidance for 800-53 controls, including implementation considerations, compensating controls, and priority adjustments.
